Everything you need in one integrated solution

Over 55 years old? It's time to act now.

Over 55 SMSF QROPS transfer service includes:

  • A complimentary report that considers your circumstances to determine if it is worth transferring and why.
  • Establishing a ROPS certified Self Managed Superannuation Fund (SMSF) for a compliant transfer.
  • Application to HMRC for ROPS status.
  • Fund registration with the Australian Tax Office (ATO).
  • A fully integrated (UK & Australia) service that tracks and manages your funds through to their deposit into your Australian Fund in an efficient and compliant manner.
  • Provision of post transfer advice to ensure your funds are integrated appropriately and set-up to effectively maximise their investment and estate planning opportunities.
Get started Keep me informed

Between 45 and 54 years old? Time to prepare

Under current rules you are not yet eligible to transfer your funds to Australia, however preparing now could save you thousands of dollars and protect against future legislative change.

Our 45 â€“ 54 service includes strategic advice to maximise your future transfer options & retirement position by:

  • Considering locking away historically high cash equivalent transfer values.
  • Considering what can be implemented in Australia and the UK to maximise your long term financial and transfer objectives.
  • Providing strategies to assist those with large transfer values who could be in breach of Australian contribution limits.
  • Maximising your British State Pension and Australian Centrelink entitlements.
Talk to a QROPS specialist Keep me informed

Under 45 years old? You're a way off being able to transfer but there is still work to be done.

Our under 45 service includes:

  • A complimentary consultation to review your financial plan.
  • Structuring your finances to allow you to successfully navigate the rules of 2 countries and maximise your outcomes.
  • Providing you with retirement projections given the possible different scenarios.
  • Determining if your family has any insurance gaps given the tax treatment of death and total & permanent disablement benefits payable from a UK pension.
  • Reviewing your estate planning arrangements.
Talk to a QROPS specialist Keep me informed
